alert.note: Alert for Acadia; Allen; Avoyelles; Evangeline; Jefferson Davis; Rapides; St. Landry (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 11 at 7:10PM CST by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Rapides, Jefferson Davis, Evangeline, northwestern Acadia, southwestern Avoyelles, northwestern St. Landry and Allen Parishes through 800 PM CST... At 709 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles north of Turkey Creek to 6 miles north of Beaver to near Oakdale to near Allen Parish Airport to near Oberlin to near Buller. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Eunice, Jennings, Oakdale, Ville Platte, Bunkie, Mamou, Welsh, Kinder, Basile, Oberlin, Iota, Glenmora, Elton, Cheneyville, Turkey Creek, Fenton, Evangeline, Cottonport, Pine Prairie and Lecompte. This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 47 and 68. Interstate 49 between mile markers 38 and 71. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Acadia; Allen; Avoyelles; Evangeline; Jefferson Davis; Rapides; St. Landry
